intro: Lacinaria scariosa f. corymbulosa, commonly known as the clustered lacinaria, is a rare and unique plant species characterized by its distinctive foliage and floral structure. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, known for its composite flower heads, and exhibits a compact, shrub-like growth habit. The plant features narrow, linear leaves with a distinctive scaly appearance, and its inflorescence consists of tightly clustered, small yellow flowers. It is typically found in arid or semi-arid environments, thriving in well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution and specialized habitat requirements, it is considered a botanical curiosity and of interest to horticulturists and botanists.
